meanings.definition: The visible shape or configuration of something.
meanings.sent1: The artist used clay to create a beautiful form of a flower.
meanings.sent2: The teacher asked the students to identify the form of the object.
meanings.sent3: The clouds took on the form of fluffy animals, making everyone smile.
meanings.sent4: Her dance movements flowed together, creating a graceful form on stage.
meanings.sent5: The sculpture captured the essence of human form in a striking way.

meanings.definition: A document with blank spaces to be filled in.
meanings.sent1: Please complete the form with your personal information.
meanings.sent2: The form requires your signature at the bottom.
meanings.sent3: The form seemed to have a mind of its own, moving around the desk.
meanings.sent4: Filling out the form felt like solving a puzzle with missing pieces.
meanings.sent5: The form lay on the table, waiting to be filled with details.

meanings.definition: A particular way in which a thing exists or appears.
meanings.sent1: The caterpillar transformed into a butterfly, changing its form completely.
meanings.sent2: Each culture has its own unique form of greeting.
meanings.sent3: The cake took an unexpected form, resembling a famous landmark.
meanings.sent4: His words took the form of a heartfelt apology, touching everyone present.
meanings.sent5: The forest at night had a mysterious form, shrouded in darkness.
